content: The "Jumpstarting Our Business Sector Act of 2013" reduces corporate income tax rates to zero and excludes net capital gain from gross income. The "Jumpstarting Our Business Sector Act of 2013" reduces corporate income tax rates to zero and excludes net capital gain from gross income. Additionally, there is a 3-year extension of bonus depreciation and 100 percent expensing for certain business assets. The "Jumpstarting Our Business Sector Act of 2013" extends bonus depreciation and 100 percent expensing for specific business assets, amending the Internal Revenue Code to change effective dates for these provisions. The "Jumpstarting Our Business Sector Act of 2013" extends bonus depreciation and 100 percent expensing for specific business assets, with special rules relating to election to accelerate AMT credit in lieu of bonus depreciation. The "Jumpstarting Our Business Sector Act of 2013" extends bonus depreciation and 100 percent expensing for specific business assets, with special rules for round 4 extension property. The Act extends bonus depreciation and 100 percent expensing for certain business assets, with special rules for round 4 extension property. Taxpayers who previously made specific elections for their taxable years may elect not to accelerate. The taxpayer may elect not to apply bonus depreciation to round 4 extension property. If no election is made, the bonus depreciation amount will be applied to eligible qualified property separately. Taxpayers who have not previously elected acceleration for specific taxable years are eligible for bonus depreciation on qualified property. Taxpayers can elect to apply bonus depreciation to their first 3 taxable years ending after December 31, 2013, and subsequent years, but only for eligible qualified property classified as round 4 extension property. The special allowance for eligible qualified property is extended under the Jumpstarting Our Business Sector Act of 2013. Conforming amendments include changing the effective dates in the Internal Revenue Code. The special allowance for eligible qualified property is extended under the Jumpstarting Our Business Sector Act of 2013. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code change effective dates to January 1, 2017 for various subparagraphs. These amendments apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2013. Repeal of estate and gift taxes under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, effective for estates, gifts, and transfers after the enactment of the Act.
